definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
to burst open/to split at the seam

sentences.english: Massage is not used for dermatosis with pathologic changes and injuries, bruise and scald.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤病病变损害处，皮开肉绽及烫伤处一般不宜推拿。

sentences.english: The rakIng of his exposed muscles agaInst the boards made him scream In agony.
sentences.chinese: 他的皮开肉绽的肌肉擦在木板上就使他痛得叫起来。

definition: to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
a black eye (idiom); serious injury to the face/fig. a setback/a defeat
